results.title: Discount Airlines Changed Flying. Now They’re in Trouble.
results.abstract: Carriers like Spirit and Frontier have lost customers to bigger competitors and seen their costs balloon. Some are in financial distress.

multimedia.caption: Spirit Airlines helped to popularize the approach of charging fees for services that had once been considered part of the cost of a ticket, like checking bags.
Spirit Airlines helped to popularize the approach of charging fees for services that had once been considered part of the cost of a ticket, like checking bags.

results.title: What’s Your Dream Senior Living Community? Take the Quiz.
results.abstract: Whether you have Jimmy Buffett on your mind or the urge to take a class or two, we’ve got a community for you.

results.title: Margs, Stars and Classic Cars: Surprising Retirement Communities
results.abstract: Those looking for a retirement plan oriented to their passions can seek out living arrangements that are increasingly catering to niche interests.
results.byline: By Sarah Bahr and David Plunkert

results.title: Two Planes Collide on LaGuardia Airport Taxiway
results.abstract: A plane that was preparing to take off struck a plane that had landed, the authorities said. One flight attendant was injured, and the F.A.A. was investigating.
results.byline: By Francesca Regalado and Mark Walker
org_facet: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

results.title: A Low-Cost Icelandic Airline Suddenly Folds, Stranding Passengers
results.abstract: Play Airlines said it was ceasing operations, becoming the second low-cost airline in Iceland to collapse in the last six years.

multimedia.caption: Play Airlines was founded in 2021.
Play Airlines was founded in 2021.

results.title: ‘Biometric Exit’ Quietly Expands Across U.S. Airports, Unnerving Some
results.abstract: The program, in which federal officers take departing international passengers’ photos, is set to grow, raising privacy concerns.

results.title: 6 New Getaways Where You Can Delight in Autumn’s Charms
results.abstract: Ranging from historic houses in Rhode Island to a sleek new motel in Colorado, these properties offer a mix of rural and urban pleasures.

multimedia.caption: The Asticou, with 82 rooms and suites, is perched above the harbor on Maine’s Mount Desert Island, near Acadia National Park.

results.title: 36 Hours in Litchfield County, Connecticut
results.abstract: Take a slow weekend exploring farms and hiking trails in Connecticut’s bucolic northwestern corner.
results.byline: By Amy Thomas and Tony Cenicola

results.title: Floating the Lazy Rivers of Nebraska’s Spring-Fed Water World
results.abstract: Deep in a sea of grass, you’ll find a surprising landscape of tiny towns, rolling dunes and sandy beaches nearly 1,000 miles from an ocean. Grab a tube.
results.byline: By Carson Vaughan and Walker Pickering

multimedia.caption: In the Sandhills of north-central Nebraska, water from the sprawling Ogallala Aquifer helps feed 5,000-acre Calamus Reservoir along with numerous rivers and creeks.

results.title: Now Arriving: A New Theory of In-Flight Turbulence
results.abstract: Physicists have devised a new model to account for the discomfort that airline passengers know all too well.

results.title: Wildflower Days and Wine-Flowing Nights in Slovenia

results.byline: By Ben Crair and Ciril Jazbec

results.title: Newark Airport Crisis Has Eased but Tech and Staffing Issues Persist
results.abstract: United Airlines said it had a very good summer at Newark airport. But air traffic control equipment issues and staffing shortages remained unresolved.

multimedia.caption: The United Airlines operations center at Newark Liberty International Airport. Newark is an important hub for the airline, accounting for about one in four of its international flights.

results.title: Help! Aer Lingus Wouldn’t Let Me Fly Because of a Visa I Didn’t Need.
results.abstract: Workers at a U.S. airport incorrectly told a Ugandan she needed a transit visa to fly through Dublin, refusing to believe even the Irish government’s own website.
